main event: On 12 February 1956 in Goose Bay, Labrador, a UFO was observed by a KC-97 aircraft and reported to have rapidly circled the aircraft, turned off its lights, and disappeared.
interesting points: The UFO was observed as an object that appeared to be an aircraft, and it was described as predominantly green with red lights.
The radar controllers also had contact with the object, but it faded when the aircraft got within 5 miles.
Weather at the time of the sighting was clear with visibility up to 25 miles and some ice crystals.
The report mentions that there were no other aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
A follow-up report confirmed the object as unidentified, and the conclusion was that it was not a known ETD (Estimated Time of Departure) activity.
